article.headline: Texas-Arlington 78, UC Riverside 77
article.story: RIVERSIDE, Calif. (AP) -- Junior forward Jermaine Griffin scored 27 points and was awarded the game-winning basket on a goaltending call with 9.4 seconds remaining to lead Texas-Arlington to a 78-77 victory over UC Riverside Monday. With the Mavericks trailing by one, Griffin's turnaround, five-foot jump shot hit the glass before Highlanders junior guard Larry Cunningham swatted the ball away. UC Riverside had one final chance, but senior guard Dedrick Bates missed a 15-foot jumper at the buzzer. Griffin shot 13-of-19 from the floor for the game and added eight rebounds for the Mavericks (4-5), who snapped their four-game losing streak. Sophomore forward Anthony Vereen added 13 points and freshman forward Tommy Moffitt scored 11 for Texas-Arlington. Four players scored in double figures for UC Riverside (3-7), which lost its fifth straight. Freshman forward Henrik Thomsen scored a career-high 23 points on 9-of-17 shooting, Bates added 13 and senior guard Justin Bell and sophomore guard Chris Johnson both scored 10. UC Riverside used a 10-0 run to take a 54-44 lead with 13:12 remaining in the second half, and the Highlanders held a six-point advantage at 75-69 with 56.9 seconds remaining. Texas-Arlington closed within 77-76 after forward Larry Posey made a lay-up on a third-chance opportunity with 17 seconds remaining. The Mavericks then forced a turnover on the ensuing in-bounds when guard Roderick Epps tied up Bell in the corner three seconds later to get a chance at the win.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
